Big Potato Games
To begin, give each player five letter tiles from the tin. Next, place 15 tiles face up on the table. This is the letter pool.
Question cards come in two levels of difficulty.
Read a card, which every-one plays. Each player must now take turns to try and spell one of the answers to the question.
Need more letters? Take one tile from the pool...
Or you can take two tiles from the tin. The first joins the pool on the table, the second goes to you. The first player to spell an answer wins those tiles and adds them to the winning stack.
The first player whose stack passes the winning line on the tin is the champ.

Begin with a terrifying Doom Card.
You and your friends are now (unfortunately) in this situation.
Fear not. Each player is given eight Object Cards.
Use one of your Object Cards to engineer the best escape imaginable.
Example:
Player 1 decides to use their \"Duck Whistle\", summoning a flock of space geese to wreak havoc on the UFO, allowing for a speedy getaway.

After everyone's told their escape plan you vote for the best. Most votes wins the Doom Card.

Restock your Object Cards and escape a new scenario.

First to three Doom Cards wins.
This is a seriously simple but madly addictive travel tile game. You can teach anyone from around the world to play it in 20 seconds even if you can\'t speak a word of their language.
First, grab a stack of tiles. Now place a tile on the table. The next player can put their tile next to any flat side of your tile, but not at the corner.
The first player to make a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line of 5 wins.
If you run out of tiles, you can reposition one of your tiles until you get a winner.
One person plays Mr Lister, the rest split into two posses. Mr Lister reads out a question.
The first team fire off an answer. If they hit a correct answer, they score a hit. If they miss they get zilch.
The second team now blast off an answer. Hit and they score. Miss and they get nada.
Each team gets three shots in total. The team with the most hits, wins the card and the drink on the back.
Win five different drinks to win the game.
If the two teams tie after three shots, they go through to the Last Chance Saloon.
Mr Lister reads the impossible question and the team nearest the correct answer wins the card.
Each player grabs a clip-board, a pen and a Scenario Card.
Take a Scrawl Card, clip it to your board and draw the best illustration of your Scenario that the world has ever seen.
Once all players are finished, have everyone pass their clipboards to the left.
Take a look at your friend\'s new drawing, attach a new Scrawl Card in front of it and write down a description.

Now pass the clipboard to the left again and illustrate your new description.\n\nContinue this way until your original clipboard has returned to you. Now take it in turns to unveil the crazy journeys your Scenarios went on.
The owner of each frame gets to vote on the best picture or words in their \'run\'. The author or artist behind it gets 1 point.
Now wipe down your cards, grab a new Scenario Card and go again. First to 10 points wins.
The aim is to guess ridiculous rhymes and win points for your team. The more points you win, the more Rhyming Pair cards you get to turn over.
Find a matching couple of Rhyming Pair cards to keep them.
First, split into two teams. Team A rolls the dice. Roll green and play a Describe It card, roll a pink to play a Solve It card, if it\'s yellow, play an Act It card.
You now have 30 seconds. One team member reads the card, the rest try to guess the rhymes.
Play a Describe It card and you describe the rhymes to your team without using any words on the card.
Play a Solve It card and read the clues on the card (in bold) to your team.
Play Act It and you act out the rhymes without making any noise.
Every time your team guesses a rhyme correctly, they earn a point.
For every three points you win, your team gets to turn over two Rhyming Pair cards. Find a pair, keep them and turn over two more. Once they\'re all gone, the team with the most pairs wins.
